body_html:
Carsten, together with Sven and Sebastian you are responsible for about 70%
of all commits. (429 out of 615, not counting merge commits). I suggest the
three of you trie to agree on a license to use, then we can ask the rest if
they will agree with that.

Obviously if others here have opinions on which license would be the most
suitable than please let us hear them!

On Wed, Aug 6, 2014 at 9:51 AM, Carsten Zimmermann <notifications@github.com

wrote:

Makes sense, thanks @plexus https://github.com/plexus !

Let's do this then. I'll setup a new issue where we can track our
contributors' agreements.

Dear esteemed Rails Girls Summer of Code contributor,

you've added a feature, fixed a bug or otherwise improved the RGSoC teams
app codebase. Thanks again for that!

Unfortunately, the project is missing a proper FOSS license. We'd like to
remedy that and put the code under but for
this, we need your help: in order to make the shift, we need you as a past
contributor to agree that you license your contributions under this new
license.

If you agree to it, simply put a short statement as a comment to this
issue. Thank you! [image: 😄]

Comments? Any other opinions on a license?

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#118 (comment)
.

| @plexus https://twitter.com/plexus | arnebrasseur.net | The Happy
Lambda https://leanpub.com/happylambda |

body:
Carsten, together with Sven and Sebastian you are responsible for about 70%
of all commits. (429 out of 615, not counting merge commits). I suggest the
three of you trie to agree on a license to use, then we can ask the rest if
they will agree with that.

Obviously if others here have opinions on which license would be the most
suitable than please let us hear them!

On Wed, Aug 6, 2014 at 9:51 AM, Carsten Zimmermann <notifications@github.com

> wrote:
> 
> Makes sense, thanks @plexus https://github.com/plexus !
> 
> Let's do this then. I'll setup a new issue where we can track our
> contributors' agreements.
> 
> Dear esteemed Rails Girls Summer of Code contributor,
> 
> you've added a feature, fixed a bug or otherwise improved the RGSoC teams
> app codebase. Thanks again for that!
> 
> Unfortunately, the project is missing a proper FOSS license. We'd like to
> remedy that and put the code under _<License we end up using>_ but for
> this, we need your help: in order to make the shift, we need you as a past
> contributor to agree that you license your contributions under this new
> license.
> 
> If you agree to it, simply put a short statement as a comment to this
> issue. Thank you! [image: :smile:]
> 
> Comments? Any other opinions on a license?
> 
> —
